resources.string: Gros Morne World Heritage Site, Newfoundland and Labrador
Lighthouse at Peggy’s Cove, Nova Scotia
Gros Morne World Heritage Site, Newfoundland and Labrador

Nova Scotia is home to over 160 historic lighthouses, but no beacon is as photographed as the one in the vibrant fishing village of Peggy’s Cove. Built in 1915, Peggy’s Point Lighthouse still keeps watch over surging ocean waves and working lobster boats. Scramble over giant rocks worn smooth by the sea and share in the view.

Undoubtedly one of the most beautiful places on earth, as vast as it is varied in landscape and experiences. Alberta is an exceptional vacation destination you won’t soon forget, filled with unique activities, urban charms and cultural jewels. Located in the heart of western Canada, the province of Alberta is bordered by the Canadian Rocky Mountains.

Saskatchewan is located in western Canada between the Canadian provinces of Alberta and Manitoba, and directly north of the U.S. states of North Dakota and Montana. Along with a rich mix of history and culture, Saskatchewan offers visitors endless freshwater fishing, water-based recreation opportunities, abundant wildlife, uncrowded parks, adventures like caning and horseback riding, farm vacations and accessible golf.

The Northwest Territories is a land of contrasts. It is 1.17 million square kilometres of mountains, forests and tundra threaded by wild, clean rivers feeding thousands of pristine lakes. Over 40,000 people live amid this rugged natural beauty. You can view rare wildlife species, from white wolves to white whales, and see herds of bison, prowling bears, moose and caribou by the thousands.

The plains of Alberta and British Columbia are the peaks of the Canadian Rocky Mountains. Banff, Jasper, Lake Louise, Fernie etc are alpine towns sprinkled throughout the Canadian Rockies. The Icefields Parkway is also an ideal area for exploring Canada wild. Kananaskis Country, Waterton, Glacier and Yoho National Parks etc are recreational areas with alpine activities and splendour.

Gros Morne National Park of Canada was designated a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 1987. It is an area of natural beauty, wildlife, and recreational activities. Visitors can hike through wild, uninhabited mountains and camp by the sea. Boat tours bring visitors under the towering cliffs of a freshwater fjord carved out by glaciers. Waterfalls, marine inlets etc.
able to delete or modify content, please enter your name and click add or delete button
A list of heritage sites has links to info pages or relevant websites, making it easy to get information

Links to any relevant websites for a particular place: When customers needs more information about a particular place, they can go directly to the relevant web site instead of searching for it on the internet.
Photo and description/information of the destination: This page shows detailed information about the heritage places including pictures.

Comments section where people get post impressions or tips: If some one wants to share his stories or opinions on a place which they have been to, this page is lets him upload his thoughts and stories freely.
Quick search function: This search function helps users to find a particular place quickly and it links to Map and info pages, so it is really convenient for users.
A Map of Canada showing the UNESCO sites and natural parks as an overview.

The app will allow users to access information about Canada national and provincial parks which have been recognized by the World Heritage Committee as some of the most significant sites on Earth. It will list both cultural and natural places. It will provide both information and pictures of the sites, and can be used as a trip planner or just for browsing through the many great places in Canada. Also it can be used as educational resources for students or who want to know Canada heritage sites.
